intro: Galium cassium f. calvescens, commonly known as the slender bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its thin, often prostrate stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically oval or elliptic in shape. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Galium genus, with the specific form 'calvescens' highlighting its slender growth habit.
